newsitem.title: ALBANIA: Shooting erupts in Tirana in monarchist march.
newsitem.headline: Shooting erupts in Tirana in monarchist march.

text.p: Shooting erupted in central Tirana on Thursday during a march organised by monarchists from the Skanderbeg Square to the headquarters of the central electoral commission.
Around 500 supporters of the king, who was wants to restored to the throne were involved in the march. It was not immediately clear who was involved in the shooting.
Witnesses said the shooting appeared to be aimed in the air and one person was being carried by two or three people after apparently being injured.
Volleys of gunfire from automatic rifles and small arms could be heard next to an international hotel where foreign observers and reporters are staying.
Monarchists staged a rally for around one hour in Skanderbeg Square and marched down the main boulevard past government buildings.

Leka, the pretender to the Albanian throne, has insisted a referendum on restoring the monarchy was supported by the majority of voters on Sunday, But the central electoral commission said on Wednesday around 35.7 percent voted in favour of the king and some 64.2 percent against.
